title: I like how people complain about lack of Variety in LCS
body: but then complain when champs are being buffed so they're more likely to be played in Worlds, instead of the normal picks.

Like they really only do that for one patch cycle.

Though the part that makes this hilarious, they usually maintain caution when messing with anything on the competitive level. Only bring the power picks in line. (Like Tankko, instead of completely trashing them because you hate his guts.) While only buffing the almost viable champs, out of hope that they might see play.

And when everything is all over, Riot can, and will, be assertive about game changes as possible cause pre season. And people will complain about that too.

Not the issue, the issue is the same set of champions is always in a cycle of Buff-Nerf-Buff-Nerf... yea 50 champions see LCS play over a couple years, but what about the other champions that never or incredibly rarely see play?  

Plus the champions they are buffing are in a relatively good spot right now, whereas other champions are horrendously under-powered or just plain broken (either not working at all or not working as intended). Hammer down the nails sticking out so all of them are in an equal position, don't pull a few other nails out and call it variety....
A lot of champs aren't picked because they don't work well agaisnt a Coordinated team, like Yi, Tryn, or Old-Malzahar. Thats something you can't fix without full reworks.

I agree and Yorick they will nerf even further into the trash if he sees any real play, but there are over 130 champions and we only see like 30-40 champions consistently. You rarely see random champions here and there and on top of the 30-40 you will see another 15-20 that happen to be FOTM for that patch. That is not the point though, it seems Riot balances around the same champions that are always played and always will be played. Even though LCS is only a fraction of the year, a large amount of time is put into balancing purely around that which effects all elos.

If you nerf the common picks of LCS, new people come in to cover the spot, not to expand the slot. 

Concerning the rest of the post i will admit that I'm not an avid watcher of LCS. I've watched only the first game that Bard saw play, but thats it. So i'm not the best person to debate this without some more details.

What i can comment about is the fact that Pro's will usually try to pick the best or safest picks. Especially in a
 coordinated team, who discuss their picks, there are always going to be those Champs who are viewed the safest/best of the best. Elsewise, they're picking champs who innately counter someone. I can't remember, but didn't Urgot see proplay as a direct counter to someone?

I don't blame Riot for balancing around a certain set of champs, because I don't think it's all their fault. Pro's are going to pick the top dogs, and that itself is tricky to make diversty work.
Or when they complain about lack of variety in LCS and then complain that champions who have been consistent staple picks like Azir get nerfed.
